Bernhard Landis, Diploma in Chemistry 
Born 3rd March 1963 in Freiburg/ Germany. Married 
  
 
Profile: 
 
 Passionate Sales Manager with a strong track record in international healthcare industry 
 28 years of sales experience with turnover responsibility up to 145 Mio €; with several sales 
awards won 
 19 years of leadership experience, leading teams up to 100 people 
 Outstanding success as regional manager, field manager and sales director and a solid expertise 
as pharmaceutical sales rep and clinic sales manager. 
 Strong performance management and coaching skills 
 Hands-on, take charge individual who is able to build and lead a highly motivated team 
 Strong customer focus with extensive experience developing relationships at a senior level 
 Excellent team player. Professional moderator, presenter and negotiator 
 
 
Key focus areas: 
 
 Leadership, recruiting, coaching and performance management 
 Responsibility for achieving and surpassing sales budgets 
 Management of (inter)national key accounts and opinion leaders 
 Creation and controlling of business and budget plans 
 Strategic instruction of sales team and joint development of tactical action plans in cooperation 
with the marketing department 
 Sales training of employees 
 Compliance Officer 
 
 
Successes:  
 
 Expansion of the Schwabe medical field sales force resulting in significant market share increases  
 Growing the leadership position of Norgine Germany in terms of sales within the European 
Norgine Group 
 Built an international sales team for a biotech start-up (Cellestis) and achieved a highly profitable 
revenue situation within 4 years -> therefore acquisition by QIAGEN 
 Successful integration of the Cellestis sales team into the QIAGEN structure whilst simultaneously 
exceeding sales targets. 250 new lab customers won 
 Launch of several innovative RX drugs and immune diagnostics 
 2005 member of Novartis Excellence Club (top 2,5% of sales and marketing team) 
 2001 Novartis Champions League (top 2,5% of sales and marketing team)

 Selection and recruitment of new field and office staff  
 Performance Management; coaching and motivation of assigned employees  
 Organisation and content of sales conferences, kick-off meetings and regional manager meetings 
 Support of Key Opinion Leaders and participation in advisory boards 
 Success analysis according to indication areas, customer groups and geography 
 Planning, determination, control of funds and expenditure of sales budgets 
 
Successes:  
 Sales 142 million € in 2019: 0.5% above plan  
 In 2016 successful expansion of the physician field service by 40 positions 
 Optimization of the sales strategy of the medical field service with the goal of a significantly higher 
customer orientation through the implementation of emotional selling 
 Improvement of the cooperation between physician and pharmacy field service
